Ok, i normally am not a mean person but heres the thing. Yesterday, my son and more than 100 junior football players were invited to training camp. We were told the kids would get to meet players and get signatures and that didn't happen. We were also told the kids were gonna do a few drills on the field, that also didn't happen. The kids that went today looks like they had a better experience than the kids yesterday. The kids waited all day in the heat, stood by the sidelines for 2 hours and then was rushed off the field 15 mins before practice ended and was told they had to stand with the public for autographs. By that time all the adults were crowded around the barriers also waiting for autographs. If the Steelers are gonna treat little leaguers to a day of fun, they should all do the same things and the team should be a little more greatful that these kids wanna come see them. These kids look up to them and wanna play because them. When they see their favorite player, they think, wow someday that could be me. But its not just the kids the teams should be greatful for.....its all fans, cause with out the fans no team or player would be where they are. The fans fuel the sport with cheering, merchandise purchasing, going to support them and traveling from afar. Some of the players were really gracious....some ignored fans all together. But i think they should be humbled cause you would be a normal person without fans big and small. #steelers
